text: Somehow you've died during the tutorial. Feel free to try again but this doesn't bode well for your mission.

text: The nearby planet shows sign of habitation and great beauty. A rudimentary automated planetary defense system is looping its message into space: "Warning! Quarantine Level 5 in effect under FHA Act 22, article 11.2. Warning! Quarantine Level 5..."
author: Maverick

text: i feel like i burned through this game already, like i have 130+ hours on my list, and then i come back just for the music

text: Does anybody else think this song is inspired by Joe Satriani's "Flying in a Blue Dream".

text: 5 years later but this comment gave some inspiration to come up with a cover arrangement for this song on guitar because I can see how it could work. Thanks

text: Just in time for the announcement of FTL - advanced edition! New weapons and new scenarios and also an ipad version!

text: Also, Advanced Edition is free for existing players. And don't forget another important thing, new music by Ben Prunty!
author: Mortyee

text: FTL and the binding of isaac are the reasons, why i love the rogue-like genre. since they perfectly create different strategies almost everytime you play them. Its awesome how alive those games feel.
author: coherent911

text: they're not roguelikes they're roguelites >:(
author: uuuh

text:
This isn't a game you just easily finish once and add to a completed games list. It needs several tries to beat the boss, but I like the challenge. You likely keep playing and unlocking new ships, even if you won.

Engi battle/explore are probably my most favorite encounters/tracks. I'm glad I bought this game and soundtrack.

text: I really love the atmospheric music in this game.  You know Gabe, another great space game that has heavily atmospheric music is Galaxy on Fire 2.  It is free on all Ios devices.
author: Eric C.

text: Ah, this game is great -- as is its music! My favorite tracks are probably either Milky Way (Battle) or Last Stand.
author: MishtahPoog

text: TY for the recommendations! Milky Way(Battle) is awesome and even reminds me a bit of Danny B. which is a great thing ;)
author: xSayPleasex

text: Very nice game and music.
author: Carlos Teixeira

text:
I think I remember Ben Prunty mentioning that this track was heavily inspired by Joe Satriani's Flying in a Blue Dream. That also may have just been my own conclusion.

Regardless, one of my favorite games, soundtracks, and the creators apparently are from my neighborhood?
author: Obby

text: Awesome soundtrack by Ben Prunty. I actually prefer the frenetic Battle versions of most of the music but Civil is one of my favourites.
author: Mark Goninon

text: A very pleasant atmospheric track, Ben Prunty crafted a very fitting soundtrack for this game, instantly transporting you into space. I've already said I'm generally not a fan of the rogue-lite genre (with its too many random elements) and it's definitely the main reason I couldn't say I love this game, but FTL's core gameplay mechanics are very fun, almost in a masochistic way when you're up against tough enemies.
author: SupraDarky
